trans-unit.source: Follow these steps to install and run MongoDB on a virtual machine running CentOS Linux.
trans-unit.target: Follow these steps to install and run MongoDB on a virtual machine running CentOS Linux.

trans-unit.source: MongoDB security features, such as authentication and IP address binding, are not enabled by default.
trans-unit.target: MongoDB security features, such as authentication and IP address binding, are not enabled by default.

trans-unit.source: Security features should be enabled before deploying MongoDB to a production environment.
trans-unit.target: Security features should be enabled before deploying MongoDB to a production environment.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Security and Authentication</linkText><title></title> for more information.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Security and Authentication</linkText><title></title> for more information.

trans-unit.source: Configure the Package Management System (YUM) so that you can install MongoDB.
trans-unit.target: Configure the Package Management System (YUM) so that you can install MongoDB.

trans-unit.source: Create a /etc/yum.repos.d/10gen.repo file to hold information about your repository and add the following:
trans-unit.target: Create a /etc/yum.repos.d/10gen.repo file to hold information about your repository and add the following:

trans-unit.source: Save the repo file and then run the following command to update the local package database:
trans-unit.target: Save the repo file and then run the following command to update the local package database:

trans-unit.source: To install the package, run the following command to install the latest stable version of MongoDB and the associated tools:
trans-unit.target: To install the package, run the following command to install the latest stable version of MongoDB and the associated tools:

trans-unit.source: Wait while MongoDB downloads and installs.
trans-unit.target: Wait while MongoDB downloads and installs.

trans-unit.source: Create a data directory.
trans-unit.target: Create a data directory.

trans-unit.source: By default MongoDB stores data in the /data/db directory, but you must create that directory.
trans-unit.target: By default MongoDB stores data in the /data/db directory, but you must create that directory.

trans-unit.source: To create it, run:
trans-unit.target: To create it, run:

trans-unit.source: For more information on installing MongoDB on Linux, see <linkText>Quickstart Unix[quickstartunix]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on installing MongoDB on Linux, see <linkText>Quickstart Unix[quickstartunix]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: To start the database, run:
trans-unit.target: To start the database, run:

trans-unit.source: All log messages will be directed to the /srv/datadrive/data/mongod.log file as MongoDB server starts and preallocates journal files.
trans-unit.target: All log messages will be directed to the /srv/datadrive/data/mongod.log file as MongoDB server starts and preallocates journal files.

trans-unit.source: It may take several minutes for MongoDB to preallocate the journal files and start listening for connections.
trans-unit.target: It may take several minutes for MongoDB to preallocate the journal files and start listening for connections.

trans-unit.source: To start the MongoDB administrative shell, open a separate SSH or PuTTY window and run:
trans-unit.target: To start the MongoDB administrative shell, open a separate SSH or PuTTY window and run:

trans-unit.source: db.foo.save ( { a:1 } ) db.foo.find() { _id : ..., a : 1 } show dbs ... show collections ... help
trans-unit.target: db.foo.save ( { a:1 } ) db.foo.find() { _id : ..., a : 1 } show dbs ... show collections ... help

trans-unit.source: The database is created by the insert.
trans-unit.target: The database is created by the insert.

trans-unit.source: Once MongoDB is installed you must configure an endpoint so that MongoDB can be accessed remotely.
trans-unit.target: Once MongoDB is installed you must configure an endpoint so that MongoDB can be accessed remotely.

trans-unit.source: In the Management Portal, click Virtual Machines, then click the name of your new virtual machine, then click Endpoints.
trans-unit.target: In the Management Portal, click Virtual Machines, then click the name of your new virtual machine, then click Endpoints.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Endpoints</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Endpoints</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add Endpoint at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add Endpoint at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Endpoints</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Endpoints</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Add an endpoint with the following settings:
trans-unit.target: Add an endpoint with the following settings:

trans-unit.source: Name: Mongo
trans-unit.target: Name: Mongo

trans-unit.source: Protocol: TCP
trans-unit.target: Protocol: TCP

trans-unit.source: Public Port: 27017
trans-unit.target: Public Port: 27017

trans-unit.source: Private Port: 27017
trans-unit.target: Private Port: 27017

trans-unit.source: This will allow MongoDB to be accessed remotely.
trans-unit.target: This will allow MongoDB to be accessed remotely.

trans-unit.source: http://www.mongodb.org/display/DOCS/Quickstart+Unix
trans-unit.target: http://www.mongodb.org/display/DOCS/Quickstart+Unix
